channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Sues Comerica Bank Over Treatment of Federal Benefits Users
item.description: The CFPB accused the Comerica banking subsidiary of deliberately hanging up on millions of Direct Express cardholders’ customer service calls, impedin...

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Head for Weekly Loss
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell and were on track for a weekly loss, while managing to hold above $3 despite recent milder temperature forecasts and thi...

item.title: The stock market’s ‘fear gauge’ is trading at lows. Why retail investors should take note.
item.description: The Cboe Volatility Index hasn’t been this low in months.

item.title: Gold Retreats After U.S. Hiring Bounces Back
item.description: Gold was little changed, retreating after rising earlier in the session, after U.S. hiring bounced back in November.

item.title: UnitedHealth shooting sparks security fears but fixes are expensive and complicated for execs and corporations
item.description: Security company execs have seen a dramatic increase in inquiries for services after the murder of Brian Thompson.

item.title: U.S Stocks Mixed After Solid Jobs Report
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite rose, while the Dow industrials slipped after November payrolls data showed the labor market remains in decent health...

item.title: How do I make sure my retirement accounts go to my wife, and then my kids, when I die?
item.description: Planning and proper documentation is required if your wishes are to be carried out

item.title: Is the U.S. jobs market weaker than it looks? Here are some hints.
item.description: The U.S. has averaged a respectable 173,000 new jobs a month since September, in a sign the labor market is still pretty healthy — but warning signs a...

item.title: Why Powell and the Fed might pause interest-rate cuts in December
item.description: Some say November’s jobs data support holding monetary policy steady.

item.title: How to Give Gifts for the Holidays and Stay on Budget
item.description: I can’t give something to everybody in my life. The trick is narrowing down the list—and keeping it all affordable.
